text: Acleris caliginosana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Alberta, British Columbia, California, Colorado, Idaho, Maine, Montana, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Ontario, Quebec, Washington and Wisconsin.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 24–29 mm. The ground colour of the forewings is deep purple or grey brown and the hindwings are mottled.McDunnough, J. 1934. The Canadian species of the Tortricid genus Peronea. Canadian Journal of Research, 1934, 11(3): 290–332 Adults have been recorded on wing nearly year round. The larvae feed on Alnus incana, Alnus rubra and Betula papyrifera.Tortricidae Food Plant Database ==References== Category:Moths described in 1863 caliginosana Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris caliginosana
